transportAdvice: The islands have no roads or motorized land vehicles, making everything within the main village on Koh Phi Phi Don accessible on foot. Inter-island and mainland connections rely entirely on ferries and longtail boats, which are widely available for hire or scheduled service.

weather.description: Cool and dry with calm seas, making January one of the best months to visit.
Sunny and dry with excellent visibility for snorkeling and diving.
Hot and mostly dry, with long sunny days and calm water conditions.
Very hot with occasional brief showers, still generally good beach weather.
The wet season begins with increasing rain and rougher seas; some boat services reduce.
Heavy monsoon rains arrive, with rough seas and limited ferry connections.
Peak monsoon month with frequent heavy rain and strong swells; many businesses close.
Continued heavy rain and choppy seas; travel to the islands can be disrupted.
Still firmly in monsoon season with persistent rain and limited tourist activity.
Rain begins to ease but seas remain unsettled; the islands start reopening gradually.
Conditions improve noticeably as the dry season approaches and tourist services resume.
Dry and pleasant with calm seas, marking the start of peak tourist season.
